definition: to write off/to cancel
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
surname Gou
see 勾當|勾当[gou4 dang4]
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin
to write off at one stroke

sentences.english: German banks are balking at writing off Greek debt.
sentences.chinese: 德国各家银行在勾销希腊债务方面畏缩不前。

sentences.english: They redlined some items on the purchasing list.
sentences.chinese: 他们勾销了采购单上的一些项目。

sentences.english: So no one should write this president or country off.
sentences.chinese: 因此不应对这位现任总统或国家一笔勾销。

sentences.english: Dheck back next week. Maybe someone will cancel their trip.
sentences.chinese: 下周来看看吧，容或有人姑且勾销旅行。

sentences.english: All past animosities are dead and buried now.
sentences.chinese: 过去所有的仇恨现在都一笔勾销了。

sentences.english: In mysterious forest, father and son the write off of two pen of favour Chou Yi associate with.
sentences.chinese: 在神秘的森林中，父子俩将过往的恩仇一笔勾销。

sentences.english: They hope he will wipe off all their debt.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望他把他们欠的债一笔勾销。

sentences.english: Abruzzi: Take my duke so we can put all this abaft us.
sentences.chinese: 握手言跟，把以前的所有一笔勾销吧。

sentences.english: Abruzzi: Take my hand so we can put all this behind us.
sentences.chinese: 握手言与，把以前的一切一笔勾销吧。

sentences.english: His hopes of marrying her were paid to by her reply to his letter.
sentences.chinese: 她给他的复信使他同她结婚的希望一笔勾销。

definition: to write off at one stroke
loan settled (business term)/business complete to the satisfaction of both parties
to be even/to be quits/to be even-steven
debt of blood (after killing sb)
debt of blood (after killing sb)
see 兩不相欠|两不相欠[liang3 bu4 xiang1 qian4]
accounts in a rotten state
to repay/to pay off a debt
long-standing debt
muddled accounts/a mess of bookkeeping
to make even/to balance/(fig.) to be even/to call it quits
lit. old account/old debt/fig. old scores to settle/old quarrels/old grudge
to settle/to finish/to conclude/to wind up
to pay back in full/to redeem a debt
debt of gratitude coupled with duty to avenge
sin/crime/wrongdoing
